briefdescription.para: Terminates the calling process.
Causes abnormal process termination.
Returns an integer absolute value.

simplesect.para: The absolute value of its integer operand.

briefdescription.para: Registers a function to run at process termination.

simplesect.para: Upon successful completion 0 is returned; otherwise, a non-zero value is returned.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to an integer.

simplesect.para: The converted value if the value can be represented.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to a long integer.

simplesect.para: The converted value if the value can be represented.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to a long long integer.

simplesect.para: The converted value if the value can be represented.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *, const void *, size_t, size_t, int(*)(const void *, const void *))
memberdef.name: bsearch

briefdescription.para: Performs a binary search on a sorted table.

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements in the array.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a matching member of the array, or a null pointer if no match is found. If two or more members compare equal, which member is returned is unspecified.

briefdescription.para: Allocates a chunk of memory and cleans it.

simplesect.para: Upon successful completion with both and size non-zero, calloc() returns a pointer to the allocated space. If either n or size is 0, then either a null pointer or a unique pointer value that can be successfully passed to free() is returned. Otherwise, it returns a null pointer and set errno to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Computes the quotient and remainder of an integer division.

simplesect.para: A structure of type div_t, comprising both the quotient and the remainder.

briefdescription.para: Terminates the calling process.
Frees allocated memory.
Gets value of an environment variable.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a string containing the value for the specified name, upon successful completion. If the specified name cannot be found in the environment of the calling process, a null pointer is returned instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns a long integer absolute value.

simplesect.para: The absolute value of the long integer operand.

briefdescription.para: Computes quotient and remainder of a long division.

simplesect.para: A structure of type ldiv_t, comprising both the quotient and the remainder.

briefdescription.para: Allocates memory.

simplesect.para: Upon successful completion with size not equal to 0, malloc() returns a pointer to the allocated space. If size is 0, either a null pointer or a unique pointer that can be successfully passed to free() is returned. Otherwise, it returns a null pointer and set errno to indicate the error.

briefdescription.para: Gets number of bytes in a character.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of bytes to consider.

simplesect.para: If s is a null pointer, mblen() returns a non-zero or 0 value, if character encodings, respectively, do or do not have state-dependent encodings. If s is not a null pointer, mblen() either returns 0 (if s points to the null byte), or returns the number of bytes that constitute the character (if the next n or fewer bytes form a valid character), or return -1 (if they do not form a valid character) and is set errno to indicate the error. In no case shall the value returned be greater than n or the value of the MB_CUR_MAX macro.
The mblen() function is not thread-safe.

briefdescription.para: Converts a character to a wide-character code.

detaileddescription.para:
pwc
Wide-character code.
s
Wide-character.
n
Number of bytes to consider.
If s is a null pointer, mbtowc() returns a non-zero or 0 value, if character encodings, respectively, do or do not have state- dependent encodings. If s is not a null pointer, mbtowc() either returns 0 (if s points to the null byte), or returns the number of bytes that constitute the converted character (if the next n or fewer bytes form a valid character), or return -1 and sets errno to indicate the error (if they do not form a valid character). In no case the value returned is greater than n or the value of the MB_CUR_MAX macro.

simplesect.para: The mbtowc() function is not thread-safe.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *, size_t, size_t, int(*)(const void *, const void *))
memberdef.name: qsort

briefdescription.para: Sorts a table of data.

parameterdescription.para: Number of elements in the array.

briefdescription.para: Generates a pseudo-random number.

simplesect.para: A pseudo-random integer.

briefdescription.para: Reallocates a memory chunk.

simplesect.para: Upon successful completion, realloc() returns a pointer to the allocated space. Upon failure, a null pointer is returned instead.

xrefdescription.para: Check if we can simply expand.

briefdescription.para: Sets seed value for pseudo-random number generator.
Converts a string to a long long integer.

simplesect.para: The converted value

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to an unsigned long.

simplesect.para: The converted value.

briefdescription.para: Converts a string to an unsigned long long.

simplesect.para: The converted value.

briefdescription.para: Issues a command.

detaileddescription.para:
command
Command to issue.
If command is a null pointer, non-zero value is returned to indicate that a command processor is available, and zero otherwise. If command is not a null pointer, the termination status of the command language is returned.

briefdescription.para: Cconverts a wide-character code to a character.

simplesect.para: If s is a null pointer,a non-zero or 0 value is returns, if character encodings, respectively, do or do not have state-dependent encodings. If s is not a null pointer, -1 is returned if the value of wchar does not correspond to a valid character, or return the number of bytes that constitute the character corresponding to the value of wchar.

briefdescription.para: Parses suboption arguments from a string.

simplesect.para: The index of the matched token string, or -1 if no token strings were matched.

briefdescription.para: Adds or change environment variable.

simplesect.para: Upon successful completion, zero is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned, errno set to indicate the error, and the environment is unchanged.

xrefdescription.para: The setenv() function shall fail if the envname argument points to an empty string or points to a string containing an '=' character.

briefdescription.para: Standard library definitions.
